name: undistinguished
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not especially respected or admired: She has the burden of being by far the best player in an otherwise undistinguished international side. He had an undistinguished career as a university lecturer in mathematics.
More examplesFewer examplesHer academic record was fairly undistinguished until she began to flourish in her writing classes.The undistinguished wine list is predominantly French, with a few American and southern hemisphere choices.Cities also require a great many small and undistinguished buildings, without which the standouts would not stand out.
